steps.title: How many Australians experience homelessness on any given night?

trackingConfig.errorMessage: Please choose one option to proceed

explanation.text: On any given night, over 122,000 Australians are experiencing homelessness. This figure includes people sleeping rough, staying in temporary accommodation, and those in other unstable housing situations.

source.text: Australian Bureau of Statistics (2021): Census of Population and Housing: Estimating Homelessness

steps.title: What is the main cause of homelessness in Australia?

trackingConfig.errorMessage: Please choose one option to proceed

explanation.text: The main cause of homelessness in Australia is the lack of affordable housing. Many people are unable to secure stable accommodation due to high rental prices and a shortage of public housing.

source.text: Australian Institute of Health and Welfare (2021): Homelessness Services

steps.title: How many children in Australia are homeless?

trackingConfig.errorMessage: Please choose one option to proceed

explanation.text: Over 17,600 children younger than 12 years are homeless in Australia. These children often rely on parks, bus shelters, or shop fronts for warmth.

source.text: Australian Bureau of Statistics (2021): Census of Population and Housing: Estimating Homelessness
